paper_abstract: We study post-stabilization of numerical integrators for an autonomous Hamiltonian system in the form H = H-1 + H-2, where H-1 and H-2 are two constants of motion. It is better to stabilize the two energies H-1 and H-2, respectively. As a particular case, the effectiveness of post-stabilization by the total energy is equivalent to one by the two independent energies when the splitting Hamiltonian becomes isotropic. paper_title: On stabilization of energy for Hamiltonian systems
